The achievements of the speaker [an7.62:: Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power
Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times
A king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king
Over a thousand valiant and heroic sons
Conquering the land girt by sea
Reigning by principle, without rod or sword
The speaker's accomplishments in differe: Seven times as a Great Brahmā
Thirty-six times as lord of gods
As a king, a wheel-turning monarch, ruler of all India
Born in a rich family, affluent and wealthy
The benefits of good deeds [an7.62:12.4]: Happiness leads to a mind of love
A mind of love leads to rebirth in higher realms
Rebirth in higher realms leads to great accomplishments and achievements
